sen.j: 堀河天皇（ほりかわてんのう、承暦3年7月9日（1079年8月8日） - 嘉承2年7月19日（1107年8月9日））は平安時代後期の第73代天皇（在位1086年 - 1107年）。
sen.e: Emperor HORIKAWA (August 8th, 1079 - August 9th, 1107) was the 73rd Emperor during late Heian Period. (His reign was 1086 - 1107.)
Emperor Horikawa (August 8, 1079 - August 9, 1107) was the seventy-third Emperor during the late Heian period (his reign was from 1086 - 1107).
Emperor Horikawa (August 8, 1079 - August 9, 1107) was the seventy-third Emperor during the late Heian period (his reign was from 1086 - 1107).

sen.j: 諱は善仁（たるひと）。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Taruhito.
sen.cmt: 諱 サンプル訳より, 諱→personal name [いみな]
sen.e: His posthumous name was Taruhito.
His posthumous name was Taruhito.

sen.j: 白河天皇の第二皇子、母は藤原師実の養女・中宮藤原賢子。
sen.e: He was the second Prince of Emperor SHIRAKAWA and his mother was the second consort of the Emperor, FUJIWARA no Kenshi, who was an adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Morozane.
He was the second prince of Emperor Shirakawa, and his mother was FUJIWARA no Kenshi, the second consort of the Emperor and an adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Morozane.
He was the second prince of Emperor Shirakawa, and his mother was FUJIWARA no Kenshi, the second consort of the Emperor and an adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Morozane.

sen.j: 准母に同母姉てい子内親王（郁芳門院）。
sen.e: His Junbo, who was given the same rank as Emperor's birth mother, was his half older sister, Princess Teishi.(Iku ho monin)
sen.cmt: 准母→[定訳不明、（天皇の母に准ずる意）多く内親王に皇后または院号を賜る時の称] [Junbo is a person who was given same rank as Emperor's mother.]
sen.e: His junbo was his older half-sister, Princess Teishi (Iku ho monin).
His Junbo, who was given the same rank as the Emperor's birth mother, was his older half-sister, Princess Teishi.(Iku ho monin)
sen.cmt: 文法。 “as Emperor's birth mother, was his half older sister,”=>”as the Emperor's birth mother, was his older half-sister,”

tit.cmt: "Biography" -> "Brief Personal History" に変更しました。

sen.j: 応徳3年（1086年）11月26日、立太子と同日に、8歳で父から譲位され即位した。
sen.e: On November 26th, 1086, he became Crown Prince, and also he succeeded to the throne from his father when he was eight years old, on the same day.
On November 26, 1086, he became the crown prince; on the same day, at the age of eight years, he succeeded to the throne from his father.
On November 26, 1086, he became the crown prince; on the same day, at the age of eight years, he succeeded to the throne from his father.

sen.j: 関白藤原師実が摂政となるが、上皇となった白河院が院政を敷き、全権を掌握した。
sen.e: The chancellor (chief advisor to the emperor), FUJIWARA no Morozane became regent and the ex-Emperor SHIRAKAWA started to rule cloister government to take whole control of the politics.
The chancellor (chief advisor to the emperor), FUJIWARA no Morozane, became regent and the ex-Emperor Shirakawa started to rule the cloister government in order to take full control of the politics.

The chancellor (chief advisor to the emperor), FUJIWARA no Morozane, became regent and the retired Emperor Shirakawa started to rule the cloister government in order to take full control of the politics.

sen.j: 堀河天皇は政治に携わることなく、学問と和歌、管弦に情熱を注いだ。
sen.e: Emperor HORIKAWA did not get involved in the politics, he put his passion into studies, poems and wind and string instruments.
Emperor Horikawa did not get involved in politics but instead put his passion into studies, poems and wind and string instruments.
Emperor Horikawa did not get involved in politics but instead put his passion into studies, poems and wind and string instruments.

sen.j: 女御藤原苡子（贈皇太后）との間に生まれた皇子宗仁親王（鳥羽天皇）を皇太子としたが、苡子が没すると宗仁親王は白河院に引き取られ、院の下で養育された。
sen.e: The Crown Prince was Prince Munehito (the Emperor TOBA) who was a child of FUJIWARA no Ishi, a high-ranking lady in the court (a wife of an emperor) (the Empress Dowager, posthumously conferred), however after Ishi died, Prince Munehito was taken to Shirakawa in and nurtured in the palace.
sen.cmt: 女御→a high-ranking lady in the court (a wife of an emperor)[定訳不明]
sen.e: The crown prince was Prince Munehito (the Emperor Toba), who was a child of FUJIWARA no Ishi, a high-ranking lady in the court (a wife of an Emperor) (the Empress Dowager, posthumously conferred); however, after Ishi died Prince Munehito was taken to Shirakawa in and nurtured in the palace.

The crown prince was Prince Munehito (the Emperor Toba), who was a child of FUJIWARA no Ishi, a high-ranking lady in the court (a wife of an Emperor) (the Empress Dowager, posthumously conferred); however, after Ishi died Prince Munehito was taken to Shirakawa in and nurtured in the palace.

sen.j: 叔母にあたる中宮篤子内親王の薫陶を受け、廷臣らに慕われた賢帝であったが病弱で、帝位にあるまま29歳で亡くなった。
sen.e: The Emperor was under Princess Tokushi's tutelage who was an aunt and a high-ranking lady in the court (a wife of an emperor), he was a good Emperor being loved by courtiers although he was weak, died when he was twenty nine years old while still in power.

The Emperor was under the tutelage of Princess Tokushi, who was an aunt and a high-ranking lady in the court (a wife of an Emperor); he was a good Emperor, being loved by courtiers, although he was weak; he died at 29 years of age while still in power.

The Emperor was under the tutelage of Princess Tokushi, who was an aunt and a high-ranking lady in the court (a wife of an Emperor); he was a good Emperor, being loved by courtiers, although he was weak; he died at 29 years of age while still in power.

sen.j: なお、臨終の様子は乳母子である典侍藤原長子の『讃岐典侍日記』に詳しい。
sen.e: There are detailed description of his mortal moment in "The Sauki no Suke Diary" written by his Educator, Nashi no suke, FUJIWARA no Nagako.
There are detailed descriptions of his mortal moment in "The Sauki no Suke Diary" written by his educator, Nashi no suke, FUJIWARA no Nagako.
There are detailed descriptions of his mortal moment in "The Sanuki no Suke Diary" written by his educator, Naishi no suke, FUJIWARA no Nagako.

sen.j: ちなみに、マラリアに罹患していたとする説が、明治34年頃には、存在した。
sen.e: There was a theory around Meiji 34 that he was contracted by malaria.
There was a theory surrounding Meiji 34 that he had contracted malaria.
There was a theory that he had contracted malaria about 1901.

Eicho December 27, 1096 - November 21, 1097

Shotoku November 21, 1097 - August 28, 1099

Kasho April 9, 1106 - (August 9, 1107)

sen.j: 京都市右京区竜安寺の後円教寺御陵（のちのえんきょうじのみささぎ）に葬られる。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Nochi no Enkyo-ji no Misasagi, Ryoan-ji, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Nochi no Enkyo-ji no Misasagi, Ryoan-ji, in the Ukyo ward of Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Nochi no Enkyo-ji no Misasagi, Ryoan-ji, in the Ukyo Ward of Kyoto City.
